Circumstance.description: Provide information about the situation of the clause, including time, place, manner, degree, frequency, duration, extent.

Time.description: Indicate when the action or event takes place.

Place.description: Indicate the location of the action or event.

Manner.description: Describe how the action is performed or the means by which it occurs.

Degree.description: Express intensity or completeness of the action.

Intensifier.description: Boost intensity or strength of the proposition.

Downtoner.description: Reduce intensity or strength of the proposition.

Approximator.description: Approximates the extent or degree of something

Quantity_Extent.description: Indicate extent or proportion of truth of a proposition.

Frequency.description: Express how often the action occurs.

Duration.description: Express how long the action lasts.

Stance.description: Express the speaker's or writer's perspective, evaluation, attitude toward or certainty about a proposition.

Epistemic Stance.description: Express the speaker’s level of certainty, doubt, or probability of the proposition.

Attitudinal Stance.description: Express the speaker’s emotional reaction or evaluation of the proposition.

Style Stance.description: Comment on the manner of speaking, truthfulness, or rhetorical framing.

Focus.description: Limit, restrict, or highlight the scope of the clause, or add to what has been said.

Restrictive_Exclusive.description: Limit the proposition to a restricted scope or exclusivity.

Particularizer.description: Highlight or single out a specific part of the proposition.

Linking.description: Connect the current clause to prior discourse, showing logical relationships including result, contrast, concession, addition, enumeration, summation and transition.

Result.description: Indicate an outcome or result of what was stated before.

Contrast/Concession.description: Express opposition, concession, or contrast between clauses.

Addition.description: Add information in relation to the prior clause.

Enumeration.description: Organize discourse by listing points in order.

Transition.description: Mark a shift in topic or provide a digression.

Discourse.description: Manage or frame interaction with the reader or speaker in the discourse.

Organizers.description: Mark discourse boundaries or manage the flow of conversation.

Interpersonal markers.description: Frame the interpersonal relationship between speaker and hearer.

Text-Deictic.description: Refer to locations within the text or discourse, not physical space.
